description: A compact guide for zero-day vulnerability research, with snippets for fuzzing, exploit development, and CVE analysis. Perfect for security researchers and bug bounty hunters in a single README.md. (170 chars) Keywords: zero-day, exploit development, fuzzing, CVE analysis, bug bounty.
CVE-2024-38063 is a critical security vulnerability in the Windows TCP/IP stack that allows for remote code execution (RCE)

Repository containing writeups of CTF machines from platforms like HackTheBox, HackMyVM, and VulNyx. It includes detailed steps for exploiting vulnerabilities, privilege escalation, and post-exploitation.

Hands-on exploitation of memory vulnerabilities in C, including buffer overflow and format string attacks. Demonstrates secure coding practices, return address hijacking, and ASLR bypass using GDB and crafted payloads.
PICO-8 v0.2.6b Sandbox Escape + RCE Exploit
Detects buffer overruns and memory leaks.
<no description>
Collection of Hack The Box writeups, covering various challenges including Active Directory, web exploitation, and privilege escalation.
Smart-doc is a java restful api document generation tool. Smart-doc is based on interface source code analysis to generate interface documentation, completely zero-injection.

(PoC) CVE-2025-27210, a precise Path Traversal vulnerability affecting Node.js applications running on Microsoft Windows. This vulnerability leverages the specific way Windows handles reserved device file names
Includes Glibc Heap Explanation, Heap Exploitation, Use after free vulnerability, Buffer Overflow etc.
Server with vless+reality on board for my friends to bypass internet censorship
LFI: Practical, Efficient, and Secure Software-based Sandboxing

A drop-in replacement for PHP's default session handler which stores session data in a MySQL database, providing better performance, better security and protection against session fixation and session hijacking
jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.
Automatic SQL injection and database takeover tool
<no description>
A modern browser extension for Chrome &amp; Firefox that provides live analysis of your IP address, geolocation, DNS leaks, and WebRTC leaks.
ezXSS is an easy way for penetration testers and bug bounty hunters to test (blind) Cross Site Scripting.
WebKit Heap Use-After-Free Proof-of-Concept (PoC) https://dark-life944.github.io/poc/
This repository contains all the XSS cheatsheet data to allow contributions from the community.
Buffer overflow and memory corruption exploit exercises from the Protostar wargame. Analyzing, crafting payloads, and demonstrating step-by-step exploitation techniques using GDB and Python.
ðŸŒ™ðŸ¦Š Dalfox is a powerful open-source XSS scanner and utility focused on automation.
Complete list of LPE exploits for Windows (starting from 2023)
Windows 7 RCE via SMBv1 buffer overflow in srv.sys
Repository for information about 0-days exploited in-the-wild.
The extra fast, minimum code size, GC-free DI (Dependency Injection) library running on Unity Game Engine.
Last project of 32 bit binary exploitation. There is now security to avoid exploitation but the goal is to bypass them in order to escalate privilege.
A blind XSS detection and XSS data capture framework
Deep-dive into C-family memory vulnerabilities â€” stack overflow, heap corruption, format strings, and more.

This repository contains a Proof of Concept (PoC) exploit for the **CVE-2025-47175** vulnerability found in Microsoft PowerPoint.   The vulnerability is a Use-After-Free (UAF) bug that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code by tricking a user into opening a specially crafted PPTX file.

A compact guide for zero-day vulnerability research, with snippets for fuzzing, exploit development, and CVE analysis. Perfect for security researchers and bug bounty hunters in a single README.md. (170 chars) Keywords: zero-day, exploit development, fuzzing, CVE analysis, bug bounty.

A list of practical projects that anyone can solve in any programming language (See solutions). These projects are divided into multiple categories, and each category has its own folder.  To get started, simply fork this repo.  CONTRIBUTING See ways of contributing to this repo. You can contribute solutions (will be published in this repo) to existing problems, add new projects, or remove existing ones. Make sure you follow all instructions properly.  Solutions You can find implementations of these projects in many other languages by other users in this repo.  Credits  Problems are motivated by the ones shared at:  Martyr2â€™s Mega Project List Rosetta Code Table of Contents Numbers Classic Algorithms Graph Data Structures Text Networking Classes Threading Web Files Databases Graphics and Multimedia Security Numbers Find PI to the Nth Digit - Enter a number and have the program generate PI up to that many decimal places. Keep a limit to how far the program will go.  Find e to the Nth Dig...
